The CHAPSim_post Averaged Class - CHAPSim_AVG¶

This is the documentation for the core averged classes for extracting raw data from CHAPSim’s results folder

class CHAPSim_post.CHAPSim_post.CHAPSim_AVG_io(*args, **kwargs)¶
bulk_velo_calc(PhyTime=None)¶

Method to calculate the bulk velocity against the streamwise coordinate

PhyTime(int,float), optional

Physical time, by default None

ndarray

array containing the bulk velocity

check_PhyTime(PhyTime)¶

Checks whether the physical time provided is valid and if not whether it can be recovered.

PhyTimefloat or int

Input Physical time to be checked

float or int

Correct or corrected physical time

int_thickness_calc(PhyTime=None)¶

Calculates the integral thicknesses and shape factor

PhyTimefloat or int, optional

Physical ime, by default None

ndarray:

Displacement thickness

ndarray:

Momentum thickness

ndarray:

Shape factor

plot_Reynolds(comp, x_vals, PhyTime=None, norm=None, Y_plus=True, fig=None, ax=None, line_kw=None, **kwargs)¶

Plots the wall-normal distribution of the Reynolds stresses

compstr

Component of the Reynolds stress tensor to be process

x_valslist or int/float

streamwise locations to be plotted

PhyTimeint or float, optional

Physical time, by default None

normstr, optional

how the Reynolds stresses are normalised. if ‘wall’ they are local inner scaled; ‘local-bulk’ by the local bulk velocity None then default normalisation , by default None

Y_plusbool, optional

Whether y coordinate is local wall normalised or not, by default True

figCHAPSimFigure, optional

Pre-existing figure, by default None

axAxesCHAPSim, optional

Pre-existing axes, by default None

line_kwdict, optional

keyword arguments to be passed to the plot method, by default None

CHAPSimFigure, AxesCHAPSim

output figure and axes objects

plot_Reynolds_x(comp, y_vals_list, Y_plus=True, PhyTime=None, fig=None, ax=None, line_kw=None, **kwargs)¶

Plots a Reynolds stress component against the streamwise coordinate or time

compstr

Component of the Reynolds stress tensor to be process

y_vals_listlist or “max”

contains y coordinates to be processed or max if the wall normal maximum is desired

Y_plusbool, optional

Whether the coordinates in y_vals list are local inner-scaled, not relevant if y_vals_list is `max’. by default True

PhyTime(int or float), optional

Physical time, by default None

figCHAPSimFigure, optional

Pre-existing figure, by default None

axAxesCHAPSim, optional

Pre-existing axes, by default None

line_kwdict, optional

keyword arguments to be passed to the plot method, by default None

CHAPSimFigure, AxesCHAPSim

output figure and axes objects

plot_bulk_velocity(PhyTime=None, fig=None, ax=None, line_kw=None, **kwargs)¶

Method to plot the bulk velocity variation in the streamwise direction

PhyTime(float,int), optional

Physcial time, by default None

figCHAPSimFigure, optional

Pre-existing figure instance, by default None

axAxesCHAPSim, optional

Pre-existing axes instance, by default None

line_kwdict, optional

keyword arguments to be passed to the plot function, by default None

**kwargs

keyword arguments to be passed to the figure/subplot creation function

CHAPSimFigure, AxesCHAPSim

returns the figure and axes instances associated with the bulk velocity

output figure and axes objects

tau_calc(PhyTime=None)¶

method to return the wall shear stress array

PhyTime(float,int), optional

Physical time, if value is invalid or None the routine will attempt recovery, by default None

ndarray

Wall shear stress array

wall_unit_calc(PhyTime=None)¶

returns arrays for the friction velocity and viscous lengthscale

PhyTimefloat or int, optional

Physical time, by default None

ndarray:

Friction velocity array

ndarray:

Viscous lengthscale array

save_hdf(file_name, write_mode, key=None)¶

Saving the CHAPSim_AVG classes to a file in hdf5 file format

file_namestr, path-like

File path of the resulting hdf5 file

write_modestr

Mode of file opening the file must be able to modify the file. Passed to the h5py.File method

keystr (path-like), optional

Location in the hdf file, by default it is the name of the class
